The Lord would have men walk humbly before Him. It would be a mistake for us to purchase or erect large buildings in the cities of Southern California for sanitarium work; and those who see advantages in doing this, are not moving understandingly. A great work is to be done in preparing these cities to hear the gospel message; but this work is not to be done by fitting up in them large buildings for the carrying forward of some wonderful enterprise. Ms 114, 1902, pp. 3, 4. ("Instruction Regarding Sanitarium Work," 
                                                                           248
September 1, 1902.)
